dialogue.speaker: TRANSCRIBER'S NOTE
dialogue.text: Rachel has two friends that are not named, so I referred to them as Friend No. 1 and Friend No. 2.}

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, the whole gang is there including Janice.]

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Janice has a question. Who of the six of you has sleep with the six of you?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Wow, it’s like a dirty math problem.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I’m sorry the answer there would be...none of us.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Come on over the years none of you ever y'know, got drunk and stupid.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well, that’s really a different question.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: I’m sorry I find it hard to believe that a group of people who spends as much time together as you guys do has never bumped uglies.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well, there was that one time that Monica and Rachel got together.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA AND RACHEL
dialogue.text: What?!!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Excuse me, there was no time!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Okay, but let’s say there was. How might that go?

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Okay, okay, well then answer me this. Has any of you ever.... almost?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Does anybody need more coffee?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, I’ll take some.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, there’s a dog out there!

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Phoebe’s, three years earlier, Phoebe, Monica, and Ross are
there]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, that is so unfortunate.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Cute naked guy is really starting to put on weight.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (entering from bedroom) Okay, I’ll be back in just a minute. Oh, Phoebe I’m sorry that I left lipstick marks on the phone.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: You didn’t leave lipstick marks on the phone.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, then it must’ve been you. Bye. (leaves)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (angrily) Bye-bye! (to Ross) That’s why I moved out.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey, y'know while we’re on that, when are you gonna tell my sister that you don’t live here anymore.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I think on some levels she already knows.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Phoebe, she doesn’t know that you sneak out every night, she doesn’t know that you sneak back every morning, and she doesn’t know that you’ve been living with your Grandmother’s for a week now.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay, well maybe not on those levels.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (entering, with a goatee) Hey.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I’m never gonna find a roommate, ever.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Why, nobody good?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well let’s see, there was the guy with the ferrets, that’s plural. The spitter. Oh-ho, and yes, the guy that enjoyed my name so much he felt the need to make a little noise every time he said it. Nice to meet you, Chandler Bing Bing! Great apartment Chandler Bing, Bing!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: So how many more do you have tomorrow?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Two. This photographer, who seemed really dull. And this actor guy, who I’m not sure about, because when he called and I answered the phone ‘Chandler Bing,’ he said ‘Whoa-whoa, short message.’

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (entering) Ross (who has his foot on the coffee table), foot on the floor or come over no more!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (to Phoebe) Sure, your dresser is missing but this she notices.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I have to go. Yeah, Carol should be home by now, soo...

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Umm, how’s it going with you guys?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, better, actually. Y'know I-I-I think I finally figured out why we were having so much trouble lately.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, really?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, y'know how I have you guys, well she doesn’t really have any close friends that are just hers, but last week she meet this woman at the gym, Susan something, and they really hit it off, and I-I-I think it’s gonna make a difference

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Chandler’s, Chandler is interviewing a potential roommate.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Soo, ah, Eric, what kind of photography do ya do?

dialogue.speaker: ERIC
dialogue.text: Oh, mostly fashion, so there may be models here from time to time, I hope that’s cool.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yes, that is cool. Because I have models here y'know......never.

dialogue.speaker: ERIC
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah, during the summer, I spend most weekends at my sister’s beach house, which you are welcome to use by the way. Although, I should probably tell you, she’s a porn star. (Chandler breaks his pencil in half)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, listen I ah, still have one more person to ah meet, but unless it turns out to be your sister, I think you’re chances are pretty good. (Eric offers to shake hands) All right. (Chandler hugs him.)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (running around the apartment pointing out things) Bedroom. Bathroom. Living room. This right here is the kitchen, and thanks for coming by, (opens door) Bye-bye.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Don’t you ah, don’t you wanna ask me any questions?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Sure. Ummm. What’s up?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well, ah, I’m an actor. I’m fairly neat. I ah, I got my own TV. Oh, and don’t worry I’m totally okay with the gay thing.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What gay thing?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Ah, y'know just in general people being gay, thing. I’m totally cool with that.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: the hallway, Monica is coming up the stairs.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well okay Jerry, thanks for stopping by.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey, Mon.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hey-hey-hey. You wanna hear something that sucks.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Do I ever.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Chris says they’re closing down the bar.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No way!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah, apparently they’re turning it into some kinda coffee place.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Just coffee! Where are we gonna hang out now?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Got me.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (to bartender) Can I get a beer.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hey, did you pick a roommate?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You betcha!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Is it the Italian guy?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Um-mm, yeah right!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: He’s so cute.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh yes, and that’s what I want a roommate that I can walk around with and be referred to as the funny one.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh look, the pool table’s free. Rack ‘em up. I’ll be back in just a minute. Get ready for me to whip your butt.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay, but after that, we’re shootin’ some pool.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (sitting at a table with some of her friends) (to waitress) Oh, um, no, no, no, no excuse me, hello. Hi. My friend ordered an onion, not an olive, and uh I ordered a rum and Diet Coke , which I don’t think this is.

dialogue.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogue.text: I am so sorry.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: That’s all right. (to her friends) I mean hard is it to get a couple drinks right, huh?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ummm, I think it’s time to see the ring again. (holds her hand out and they all scream)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah, I know.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, I don’t know. Well maybe it’s just the idea of Barry for the rest of my life. I don’t know I think I feel like I need to have one last fling, y'know, just to sorta get it out of my system. (Chandler is listening in very intensely)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I’m serious, I really, I think I need just to have some...meaningless, sex y'know, with the next guy that I see.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Excuse, I seem to have dropped my ball.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah, so?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (picks it up) And now I’ve picked it up again. (walks over to Monica.)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh my God, I went to high school with her. (to Rachel) Rachel! Hi!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Monica! Look! Hi! What do ya think? (shows her, her ring)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh my God, you can’t even see where the Titanic hit it.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yes, his name is Barry, he’s a doctor, thank you very much.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Awww, just like you always wanted. Congratulations

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Thank you. So how-how ‘bout you, are-are you seeing anybody?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Aww, not right now.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, but that’s okay.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I know.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: So, I’ll get-get back to my friend.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah, sure, sure, sure, sure. (points at Chandler, who holds up the cue ball as a ‘Remember me?’ thing) Listen, can we please have lunch the next time I’m in the city?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, that’d be great.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Thanks.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Bye!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Bye! (to Chandler) Ten bucks says, I never see that woman again in my life.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Phoebe’s, Ross is on the phone, as Phoebe is walking by
carrying a lamp.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No real-, honey, really it’s fine, just g-go with Susan. Really, I, no, I think girls night out is a great idea. Okay, okay, bye

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: So what are they doing?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I don’t know, something girlie.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (to Monica, who’s entering) Hey, you’re early.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What are you doing with the lamp?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I’m just taking it to be re-wired.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, well don’t take it to the same place you took the stereo, ‘cause they’ve had that thing for over a week.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No, no, Mr. Heckles no one is making any noise up here.

dialogue.speaker: MR. HECKLES
dialogue.text: You’re disturbing my oboe practice.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: You don’t play the oboe!

dialogue.speaker: MR. HECKLES
dialogue.text: I could play the oboe!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Then I’m gonna have to ask you to keep it down. (slams the door in his face.)

dialogue.speaker: MR. HECKLES
dialogue.text: (to Eric) Who are you?

dialogue.speaker: ERIC
dialogue.text: Hi, I’m Eric, I’m gonna be Chandler’s new roommate.

dialogue.speaker: MR. HECKLES
dialogue.text: I’m Chandler’s new roommate.

dialogue.speaker: ERIC
dialogue.text: I-I-I don’t think so.

dialogue.speaker: MR. HECKLES
dialogue.text: I could be Chandler’s new roommate.

dialogue.speaker: ERIC
dialogue.text: But, he told me over the phone.

dialogue.speaker: MR. HECKLES
dialogue.text: He told me in person.

dialogue.speaker: ERIC
dialogue.text: That’s weird.

dialogue.speaker: MR. HECKLES
dialogue.text: Well, I’m going to go into my new apartment now. (goes over to the door and opens it) Ehh! (Eric leaves)

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: the hallway, Joey is moving in, Monica is leaving.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hi, again.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey! (goes into the apartment)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (leaving to go to work) Hey!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Thank you soo, much.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, don’t thank me, thank the jerk that never showed up. Okay, I gotta get to get to work.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You want some help with that?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, no thanks, I got it. (picks it up) No I don’t!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Whoa! Are you okay?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Whew! Stood up to fast, got a little head rush.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: It’s the heat. (has her hand on his chest, and then pulls it away) And-and the humidity.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: That’s a uh, that’s a tough combination.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Do you wanna come in for some lemonade?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Like you wouldn’t believe. (they go into the apartment) Wow! This is a great place.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Thank you. Just make yourself comfortable.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Gotcha.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: This place is really my Grandmother’s. (Joey starts to take off all of his clothes, while Monica gets the glasses and pours the lemonade.) I got it from her when she moved to Florida, otherwise I could never afford a place like this. So if the landlord ever asks, I’m 87 year old woman, who’s afraid of her VCR. So are you thirsty?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, you bet I am!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (turning around) Okay, here’s your penis!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh my God!!! What are you doing?!!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: You said, you wanna come in for some lemonade?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: So?!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Whoa, ah!! We’re you just gonna give me some lemonade?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah huh!! Cover yourself up!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh right, right.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I don’t believe this! When someone asks you in for lemonade, and to you that means they wanna have sex?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well usually...yeah! Well, not just lemonade, iced tea, sometimes juice. Well, sorry, I just, I thought you liked me. I’m such a jerk.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: It’s okay. I suppose it could happen to anyone, not anyone I know, but... By the way I can still see it.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Phoebe’s, Monica is vacuuming.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Pheebs?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Huh?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Where’s your bed?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: It’s not in the apartment? (Monica gives a ‘Come on’ look) Oh no. I can’t believe this is happening again.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay, enough with the third degree! I-I’ve, I don’t live here anymore.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What are you talking about?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I’m sorry, I-I-I-I don’t live here anymore. I-I didn’t know how to tell you, but y'know everybody else knows!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Everybody knows!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: That was supposed to be a good thing, I forget why. Just listen, Monica, I, do you know, okay, do you know, I couldn’t sleep for like a month because I got like a dot of ink on one of the sofa cushions.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well, you-you coulda just turned the cushion over.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, I would’ve except I had a big spaghetti stain on the other side.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What?!?!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay, this is what I’m talking about, this. I-I need to live in a land where people can spill.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You can spill. In the sink.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Aw, honey it’s not your fault, y'know this is who you are, and I love you, and I want us to be friends, and if I keep living here I don’t see that happening.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I love you, too.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Aww, good. (they hug) What?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What? I’m just said.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No you’re not, you’re wondering which cushion it is.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, (now) Joey is watching Baywatch , as Chandler enters
from his bedroom.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: So ah, whatcha watching?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Baywatch.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What’s it about?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Lifeguards.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, it sounds kinda stupid... (looks at the TV) Who’s she?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Nicole Eggert. You'll like her.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Wow! Look at them run.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: They do that a lot. Hey, you want a beer?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, I’ll go get one.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: No, no, no, don’t get up, I got a cooler right here.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica’s, Monica is coming out of the bathroom wearing nothing but a
towel, as Chandler is entering.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, hello!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Do you have any beers? We’re out of beers.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (all depressed) Help yourself.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You okay?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Phoebe moved out.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Right.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I don’t understand, I mean am I so hard to live, is this why I don’t have a boyfriend?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Noo!! You don’t have a boyfriend because....I don’t, I don’t know why you don’t have a boyfriend. You should have a boyfriend.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well, I think so.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh-ho, come here. (goes and hugs her) Listen, you are one of my favourite people and the most beautiful woman I’ve ever known in real life.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: the bar, Ross is entering, Phoebe is at the bar, they are the only two in the
place.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (all depressed) Hi. Where is everybody?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, it’s already closed, Chris gave me the keys to lock up-what is wrong?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: My marriage, I think my marriage is um, is kinda over.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh no! Why?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: ‘Cause Carol’s a lesbian. (Phoebe is shocked) And, and I’m not one. And apparently it’s not a mix and match situation.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh my God! I don’t believe it! Oh, you poor bunny.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (sets out a bunch of shot glasses and starts to poor himself a drink, many drinks) I’m an idiot. I mean shoulda seen it, I mean Carol and I’d be out and she’d, she’d see some beautiful woman, and, and she’d be Ross y'know look at her, and I’d think, God, my wife is cool!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Aw! Hey, do you think that Susan person is her lover?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, now I do!!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I’m sorry.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Seven years. I mean we’ve been together seven years, she’s the only woman who’s ever loved me, and the only woman I’ve-I’ve ever....

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Aw, God Ross. Oh.(goes over and hugs him)

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica’s, Chandler and Monica are still hugging each other.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Umm, this is nice.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I know, it is isn’t it?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No, I mean it, this feels really good. Is it a hundred percent cotton?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah! And I got it on sale, too.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Anyway, I should go, one of the lifeguards was just about to dismantle a nuclear device.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well, if you wanna get a drink later we can.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, that sounds great. (starts to leave) Oh, and listen, it’s, it’s gonna be....

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I know. Thanks. (Chandler leaves)

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: the bar, Phoebe is still hugging Ross.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Maybe this would’ve happened if I’d been more nurturing, or I’d paid more attention, or I... had a uterus. I can’t believe this!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I know no, no, y'know you don’t deserve this, you don’t Ross. You’re, you’re really, you’re so good. (kisses him on the cheek)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Thanks.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: And you’re so sweet. (kisses him on the other cheek) And you’re kind (kisses him on the lips)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Thanks. (kisses her on the lips)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Wait, wait, wait, wait, wait.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Huh?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay, it’s okay.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh. (they start kissing again)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Wait, wait, wait.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: My foot is stuck in the pocket.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, I can’t get it out.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, that’s not something a girl wants to hear.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, come on don’t start. (they start kissing again) Ouch!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Stupid balls are in the way. (holds up two balls)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh well. It probably would’ve been the most constructive solution.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: You have chalk on your face.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Huh? (the rest of the gang enters)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, Ross you’re right, I don’t know why I always thought this was real grass.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hey, are you okay?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: My wife’s a lesbian.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Cool!!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ross-Joey, Joey-Ross. (they shake hands)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hi.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: the bar, Chandler is playing pool, as Rachel enters.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I can’t believe you came back.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Don’t say anything. I don’t wanna speak, I don’t wanna think. I just want you to take me and kiss me and make love to me right here, right now.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, sorry.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Um, (shyly) Barry.

dialogue.speaker: HER FRIENDS
dialogue.text: Awwww!!
